intro: Teucrium wanense, commonly known as the Wanese germander, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite leaves that are often hairy and serrated. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom during the dry season. Teucrium wanense is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in forest margins and grasslands.
